step_1.project_idea: Skills Engine is a microservice that acts as the central authority for managing all skill and competency data within the EduCore platform. It maintains a hierarchical skill taxonomy, tracks user skill profiles, verifies skills, and enables precise gap analysis. Its core purpose is to provide accurate, structured skill data to other services, supporting personalized learning, career development, and talent management. It is part of the EduCore platform which consists of 11 microservices: Directory (People Manager), Marketplace (Course Shopping), Course Builder (Course Planner), Content Studio (Lesson Creator), Assessment (Test Maker), Skills Engine, Learner AI (Personal Tutor), Learning Analytics (Progress Reporter), HR Reporting (Manager Dashboard), DevLab (Coding Practice), and Corporate Assistant (Smart Helper).
step_1.business_goals: The Skills Engine microservice establishes a single source of truth for skills and competencies across the EduCora AI platform, ensuring consistent, verified data for all training, assessments, and reporting. It enables accurate tracking of individual and team skill levels, allowing employees and trainers to identify gaps and take targeted development actions. By providing structured skill data to other services like Learner AI, Content Studio, and Course Builder, it supports competency-aligned content, courses, and learning paths, enhancing personalized learning experiences. For organizations, it delivers insights into workforce competencies, improves talent management, and ensures scalable, efficient, and data-driven decision-making for employee growth and upskilling initiatives.

step_1.problem_statement: Before Skills Engine, skill and competency data across the platform was fragmented, unstructured, and often unreliable. There was no single source of truth for skills, making it difficult to track user proficiency, identify skill gaps, and provide personalized learning paths. Skills Engine solves this by centralizing all skill data, verifying user skills, maintaining a flexible hierarchical taxonomy, and enabling precise gap analysis for career development.

vision_mission.vision: To be the central, authoritative source of skills and competencies within the EduCora AI platform, enabling transparent, data-driven skill development for every employee and supporting organizations in achieving a highly skilled, future-ready workforce.
vision_mission.mission: The Skills Engine microservice organizes, verifies, and delivers structured skill and competency data, powering accurate skill tracking, gap analysis, and competency-aligned learning experiences. It ensures that all services within EduCora AI can rely on a consistent, authoritative source of skill information, enabling personalized growth, informed talent management, and measurable learning outcomes.

skills_competency_taxonomy.FR_5_1_1: Unified Skill Hierarchy: Store the entire skill hierarchy in a single canonical skill table using a self-referencing relationship to manage parent-child connections, supporting unlimited N-level depth. Each Top-Level Skill (L1) must maintain a cached attribute for total leaf-node (MGS) count for proficiency and gap calculations.
skills_competency_taxonomy.FR_5_1_2: Atomic Skill Definition: Every skill requires a Name and Description. Most Granular Skills (MGS) must track their Primary Verification Source.
skills_competency_taxonomy.FR_5_1_3: Competency Structure: Competencies must support a maximum two-layer structure (Parent Competency → Child Competency).
skills_competency_taxonomy.FR_5_1_4: Granular Competency Requirements: Each competency defines a Minimum Proficiency Level and required Skills. Competencies can link directly to L1 skills and nested Competencies. The system must aggregate the full set of MGS from the hierarchy to determine the complete requirement set.
skills_competency_taxonomy.FR_5_1_5: Skill Relationship Network: Support many-to-many relationships between any two skills using a dedicated junction table.

data_ingestion_normalization.FR_5_2_1: Initial Import: On system initialization, define official external sources (URLs) and use AI-driven extraction to build the initial Skills Taxonomy Database.
data_ingestion_normalization.FR_5_2_2: AI Normalization: Standardize imported and user-added skills. Check for existing entries to prevent duplication before saving.
data_ingestion_normalization.FR_5_2_3: On-Demand Skill Discovery: When a missing skill/competency is requested, first perform an internal lookup. If not found, query an External Knowledge Discovery AI Tool, normalize the findings, store them in the taxonomy, and return them.
data_ingestion_normalization.FR_5_2_4: Trainer Custom Taxonomy Import: Allow Trainer users to upload a CSV with hierarchical skills/competencies.
data_ingestion_normalization.FR_5_2_5: Taxonomy Periodic Synchronization: On system activation, re-scan official URLs and trigger AI extraction only for net-new skills or competencies.

user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_1: Profile Initialization: Receive user data from Directory MS (#1), including user name, user_id, company_id, employee_type, career path, and raw external data (claimed skills, job roles, certifications, experiences). Validate and store this data in user profile tables.
user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_2: AI-Based Skill Extraction & Normalization: Process stored raw data with AI to extract granular skills and competencies, map them to the internal taxonomy, normalize synonyms/duplicates, and create the initial user skill profile.
user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_3: Initial Status: All normalized skills after mapping are initialized as verified=false.
user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_4: Primary Assignment Verification Request: After profile initialization, send required MGS for the mandatory Primary Assignment test to Assessment MS (#5) to trigger formal skill verification.
user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_5: Granular Verification: Update MGS to verified=true and store verification date upon receiving assessment results exceeding thresholds.
user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_6: Post-course Exam Handling: Support multiple exam attempts; add any newly verified MGS to the user profile and update exam status (Pass/Fail).
user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_7: User Skill Storage Format: Store individual user skill data in UserCompetency as a JSON mapping skill_id, skill_name, verification status, and last update.
user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_8: Directory Update after Baseline: After a Baseline Exam, send a secondary request to Directory MS (#1) including the calculated Relevance Score.
user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_9: Updated Profile Delivery: After any skill verification or profile update, send the updated user profile to Directory MS (#1), including: List of Competencies the user possesses, Proficiency level per Competency (BEGINNER → EXPERT), Top-Level (L1) skills directly owned by the user, Relevance Score for the Career Path Goal.
user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_10: Initial Raw Skill Storage: Store all skills extracted from raw external data in UserSkill table without hierarchical relationships; initialize as verified=false.
user_profile_verification.FR_5_3_11: Post-Baseline MGS Storage: After Baseline Exam, store verified MGS in UserCompetency JSON with: Competency → MGS mapping, Proficiency level, Top-Level (L1) skills directly owned, Relevance Score.

proficiency_calculation.FR_5_4_2: Competency Level Calculation (MGS Count): Calculate proficiency as the ratio of verified MGS to total required MGS. Coverage Percentage = (Verified MGS / Total Required MGS) × 100. Intermediate layers are ignored.
proficiency_calculation.FR_5_4_3: Proficiency Mapping: Map coverage percentage to levels: BEGINNER (0–30%), INTERMEDIATE (31–65%), ADVANCED (66–85%), EXPERT (86–100%).
proficiency_calculation.FR_5_4_4: Continuous Profile Update: After receiving a verification Pass, recalculate and update the parent Competency level. Fail does not update proficiency.
proficiency_calculation.FR_5_4_5: Relevance Score Calculation: Calculate the Relevance Score for the user's Career Path Goal using the same formula as Coverage Percentage.

gap_analysis_reporting.FR_5_5_1: User/Team Data Retrieval: Provide Learning Analytics (MS #8) access to verified user profiles and aggregated team competency status.
gap_analysis_reporting.FR_5_5_2: Skills Profile Data Provision: Provide a secure URL to render the Dedicated Skills Profile Page; missing skills derived from Broad Gap Analysis, structured as MAP (Competency ID → missing MGS list).
gap_analysis_reporting.FR_5_5_3: Automated Trigger: Automatically trigger Gap Analysis and profile updates whenever a verification score is received from MS #5.
gap_analysis_reporting.FR_5_5_4: Conditional Gap Analysis Logic: Baseline Exam → Broad Gap Analysis against Career Path Goal. Post-course Exam: FAIL → Narrow Gap Analysis for course-specific Competency, PASS → Broad Gap Analysis against Career Path Goal.
gap_analysis_reporting.FR_5_5_5: Definitive Gap Calculation: Missing MGS = Required MGS Set − Verified MGS Set
gap_analysis_reporting.FR_5_5_6: Gap Analysis Data Sent: Send structured gap-analysis results to Learner AI (MS #7) with missing skills, exam status, and related course/competency info (MAP format).
gap_analysis_reporting.FR_5_5_7: Frontend Display & Access Control: Trainer users have access to Upload File button.

skill_competency_retrieval.FR_5_6_1: Granular Skill Retrieval (Course Builder): Retrieve MGS for a given Competency; apply AI normalization and fuzzy-matching. If missing/incomplete, dynamically discover and import skills before returning the full MGS list.
skill_competency_retrieval.FR_5_6_2: Granular Skill Retrieval (Content Studio / Learner AI): Retrieve MGS for a given Competency from internal database only, without triggering external discovery.

skill_competency_normalization.description: AI extracts skills/competencies from user raw data. Skills are normalized to the existing taxonomy using synonym matching and semantic similarity. Duplicates are removed. All extracted skills are stored as unverified until validated.

determining_required_mgs.description: Each competency defines required Most Granular Skills (MGS). The system flattens the full hierarchy (Competency → Skills → MGS) to produce a complete MGS requirement list.

dynamic_discovery_rules.course_builder: If Course Builder requests a competency that does not exist, the system performs external AI-based discovery and saves the new data.
dynamic_discovery_rules.content_studio_learner_ai: If Content Studio or Learner AI requests a missing competency, only internal lookup is allowed (no external discovery).

verification_workflow.description: Assessment MS sends exam results (Baseline or Post-course). Skills that meet the threshold are marked verified=true. Verified skills update parent skills and update competency proficiency.

competency_level_calculation.mapping: Coverage is mapped to 4 levels: BEGINNER (0-30%), INTERMEDIATE (31-65%), ADVANCED (66-85%), EXPERT (86-100%)
competency_level_calculation.update_rule: Levels update automatically after each verification event.

relevance_score_logic.description: Relevance Score uses the same coverage formula as competency proficiency. Represents user alignment with their Career Path Goal.

gap_analysis_rules.trigger: Triggered whenever new exam results arrive.
gap_analysis_rules.baseline_exam: Baseline Exam → Broad Gap Analysis (full career path).
gap_analysis_rules.post_course_fail: Post-course FAIL → Narrow Gap Analysis (only the competency of the course).
gap_analysis_rules.calculation: Gap = Required MGS – Verified MGS, grouped by competency.

profile_update_logic.description: After each verification or profile change, the system returns an updated profile to Directory MS including: Competencies + proficiency level, Top-level skills directly owned by the user, Verified MGS, Relevance Score.

storage_rules.extracted_skills: Extracted skills are stored in UserSkill table.
storage_rules.verified_data: Verified skills and competency-level data are stored in UserCompetency as JSON.

reliability.backup_recovery: Regular database backups, ability to recover from data loss
reliability.monitoring: Comprehensive logging and monitoring for system health, error tracking, and performance metrics

ai_capabilities.name: Source Discovery
ai_capabilities.purpose: Identify official external sources for skills and competencies
ai_capabilities.prompt_specification: Generate list of authoritative URLs for skills and competencies
ai_capabilities.expected_output: List of valid URLs to feed into the extraction workflow

ai_capabilities.name: Deep Web Scanning / Extraction
ai_capabilities.purpose: Scrape or call APIs on official sources to extract hierarchical skills and competencies
ai_capabilities.prompt_specification: Input: source URLs. Instruction: Extract skills/competencies in a hierarchical format (Competency → Skill → Sub-skill → N-levels)
ai_capabilities.expected_output: Verified hierarchical data ready for normalization

ai_capabilities.name: Skill & Competency Extraction from Raw User Data
ai_capabilities.purpose: Process user-provided raw data (resumes, LinkedIn, GitHub, ORCID, Credly) to extract granular skills and associated competencies
ai_capabilities.prompt_specification: Input: raw text data. Instruction: Identify skills, competencies, synonyms, and map to internal taxonomy
ai_capabilities.expected_output: List of normalized skills and competencies, ready for storage in user profile

ai_capabilities.name: Normalization of Skills and Competencies
ai_capabilities.purpose: Standardize terminology, merge duplicates, unify synonyms, and ensure consistent hierarchical structure
ai_capabilities.prompt_specification: Input: extracted skills/competencies. Instruction: Normalize terms, detect duplicates, unify hierarchy

ai_capabilities.name: Validation of Extracted Data
ai_capabilities.purpose: Validate completeness, accuracy, and hierarchical correctness of extracted skills and competencies before storage
ai_capabilities.prompt_specification: Input: hierarchical extracted data. Instruction: Check for completeness, missing levels, inconsistencies, duplicates, and assign confidence scores
ai_capabilities.expected_output: Flagged entries, confidence scores, verified hierarchical structure ready for storage

ai_capabilities.name: On-Demand Skill Discovery for Missing Competencies
ai_capabilities.purpose: When a competency is requested but not found internally, perform external search to discover missing skills/competencies
ai_capabilities.prompt_specification: Input: missing competency name. Instruction: Search for relevant sources, extract, normalize, and return hierarchical skills
ai_capabilities.expected_output: New competency and skills data, normalized and ready to integrate into the canonical taxonomy
